Now that you mentioned a menpo I can't look at the thing without seeing a nose.  Time for me to step away from the computer...

The slab gongs I'm thinking of do have a small central perforation like that though, which a menpo nose would not.  I suppose that it could be there to suggest the point of the nose.

Jim



  Huh,
      almost disappointed to learn its a gong.

  I preferred the 'nose' theory. I thought it might be
  an image of the nose plate on the Japanese mempo,
  since many of these were detachable.

  Somewhere along the history, at least one katchushi
  tsuba must have come from a noseplate hammered flat
  and fashioned into a quick tsuba?

  Curran
